result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G. Fitzpatrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appears in custody from JASO with attorney Gina Bosben present.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  State has properly notifed the victims in all of the cases.  Restitution of several checks were not charged will be read-in for restitution purposes.  That information in detail was stated on the record.  PSI and alternate PSI have been reviewed by the Court.  State has no factual corrections.  Defense has one factual change that his sister, J.F. state she did not tell him to leave after living with her for 4 months.  J.F. is present and states he has never lived with her.  Judge questions Agent Miles present in the courtroom regarding this.  No other corrections noted.  State gives sentencing recommendations on all cases; states probation is not appropriate in these cases.  Judge requests Agent Miles to make statement regarding recommendations in PSI.  Both ADA Inlow and attorney Bosben question Agent Miles.  Defense counsel states her recommendation for sentencing is probation and jail as noted by DOC in PSI and elaborates; requests half-priced IID be ordered on 15CM121.  Defendant excercises his right to allocution and reads a statement.  

15CM121 - Sentence:  $600 fine + costs and may set up a payment plan when out on extended supervision, 65 days jail, 24 mos. DL revocation, 24 mos. IID and Court finds he's indigent and is eligible for reduced costs on IID at time of application, credit for 1 day served.  Concurrent to 15CF67, 15CF218, 15CM118, and 15CM83.

15CF67, Ct 1 - sentenced to 10 years bifurcated 5 yrs. confinement and 5 yrs ES; Ct 2 & 3 - sentenced to 5 years bifurcated 3 years confinement and 2 years ES, both counts concurrent with Count 1, restitution ordered of $4108.34 to Acuity Insurance, credit for 50 days served, must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, costs.  

15CM118 - sentenced to 9 months jail with credit for 1 day jail, concurrent to 15CF67, 15CM121, 15CM83, 15CF218, costs.  

15CM83 - 9 months jail concurrent to 15CM121, 15CF67, 15CM118 and 15CF218 plus costs.

15CF218, Ct 2 -  sentenced to 2 years bifurcated 1 year incarceration and 1 year ES with credit for 140 days served, to be consecutive to 15CF67, 15CM83, 15CM118, 15CM121, restitution ordered to Wal-Mart for $25.94 and restitution ordered as read-in from 15CF170 for $335.00 to Black River Country Bank, $350.00 to Kwik Trip, $40.00 to Full Moon Saloon, and costs.

Extended supervision conditions - No contact of any kind unless approved by agent with the following people:  Jesse or Kristy Honaker, Jason Ott, Greg Simplot, Mary Fisher, Sandra Smith, and Josh Hoffman.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  No association with any known illegal drug dealers or users.  No contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with any of the victims in the cases or their property.  Must comply with all recommendations of DOC for any AODA or mental health needs.  

Court finds not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Court orders restitution is to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.  Costs and surchages ordered on all cases as applicable.  Jail credit was ordered as specified in the letter filed by attorney Bosben today.  Felony warning given.
From attorney Gina Bosben to Judge regardin jail credit (with attachment from jail)
from DOC
Sentencing hearing on April 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  A supplemental PSI was requested, but DOC did not prepare one.  No one in the court system was told it was not going to be done.  PSI writer was ordered to appear, and did not appear.  Inaccurate and not fair to the defendant or the state.  May be additional inaccurate information in the "corrected" PSI.  Missing information on page 1.  Attorney Bosben also concerned.  Jail credit not included.  Defendant wishes to proceed today.  State made a record of his concerns.  OTSC will be drafted for willfully failing to comply with the court's order.   DOC must provide supplemental PSI and appear for the sentencing hearing.  Attorney Bosben may appear by telephone for the contempt hearing on 4/15/16 at 11:00 am.  Sentencing hearing 4/29/16 at 9:30 am.  1 - 1/2 hour block.
Sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 02:00 pm
Alternative - copy to Judge by J.A. and I sent one to DA
Corrected.   Paper copies to DA and Attorney Bosben.  E-mailed to Judge.
NOH for sentencing 2-26-16  - "No Such Number Unable to Foward"
Sentencing hearing at 02-26-2016 01:30 pm
from DOC to extend due date for PSI
NOH for Sentencing hearing 1-21-16 "No Such Street Unable to Forward"
Sentencing hearing at 01-21-2016 11:00 am

Current: W10640 Hawley Rd., Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2015)
Prior: PO Box 452, Black River Falls, WI 54615

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Bosben.  Victim notification complied with.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Count 2 is dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of count 1.  PSI ordered due 12/18.   SEH set for   1/21/16 at 11:00 am.  Bond continued.
Plea hearing at 11-02-2015 04:00 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Bosben.  Defendant ready to plead.  Victims not notified.  Set for plea/sentencing

Pre-trial conference at 10-07-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 10-19-2015 03:00 pm.
Status conference at 09-17-2015 10:45 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Bosben.  State has a new referral that has not been generated yet.  Schedule 15CF67 for preliminary hearing. Schedule new case for initial on the same date and time as the preliminary hearing.  1 hour.  Track all other cases with the prelim.
Status conference at 07-24-2015 08:45 am

Defendant appeared with counsel Gina Bosben.  Attorney Sherman represents him on the CT cases and he does not appear.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  State moves to dismiss 14CT71 and 14CT74.  Court grants the Motion and dismisses both cases.  He still has other open cases with one more to be filed.  DA requests another 30 days.  Court set all remaining cases for status on 7-24-15 at 8:45.  Attorney Bosben can appear by phone and we will call her.

Applies to 15CF67, 15CM83, 15CM118 and 15CM121.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  T.B. and P.J., their residences or employment.  Not to possess any firearms.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Court advised the charges and possible penalties.  AIA set for 5/29/15 at 1 pm on 15CM212 and 15CM118.

Covers cases 15CF67 and 15CM83.  Amended 5-8-15:  Defendant may be released from Jackson County Jail on electronic monitoring and must go directly to a hospital for medical treatment.  When his medical provider has deteremined it's appropriate to be released the defendant must call the Jackson County Sheriff's Department immediately and he will be picked up at the facility.  He must return to the Jackson County Jail immeidately upon release from the hospital and must make no other stops between the hospital and the jail.  Once defendant is back in the jail the bond returns to a $1000 cash bond with all previous conditions as listed below:

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel Gina Bosben present in court.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense waived reading of complaint and requests the $3500 cash bond be reduced for cases 15CF67 & 15CM83; 15CM83 - defendant stands mute; 15CF67 - defense waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Court reviews time limits with defendant and accepts his waiver; enters not guilty pleas on 15CM83 and set for pretrial on 5-17-15 and a status on 6-15-15 at 3:00.  DA Fox agrees with bond amount being reduced.  Court orders cash bond reduced to $1000 with previous conditions ordered.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County jail without counsel present.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant states he doesn't have representation yet.  Court urges SPD to appoint someone soon and finds good cause to continue case.  Adjourned initial set for 5-4-15 at 9:30.  Clerked by JMM
Adjourned initial appearance at 05-04-2015 09:30 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Charles Betthauser appeared specially.  Discussion held on whether SPD or Attorney Sherman will represent defendant.  Attorney Betthauser told the court that they have not been formally retained by defendant.   Attorney Betthauser requested a minimal cash bond, or $5,000 signature bond.  Court lowered the cash bond to $3,500.00 with all previous conditions.
